str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
Worthily, in a manner worthy of. Adverb from axios; appropriately.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Pleasing, willing service. From a derivative of aresko; complaisance.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To bear fruit. From karpophoros; to be fertile.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to grow, i.e. Enlarge.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
